headline: Electronic Arts Beats First-Quarter Bookings Forecasts Ahead of Big Game Launches
summary: Electronic Arts’  fiscal year is off to a solid start, as the video game company beat quarterly bookings expectations ahead of a crucial few months for game releases.  EA  posted earnings of 79 cents a share for its fiscal first quarter, above management’s forecasted range of 49 to 66 cents.  Net bookings totaled $1.3 billion, up from $1.26 billion last year and above the consensus call of $1.25 billion from analysts tracked by FactSet.

headline: Electronic Arts (EA) Q1 Earnings and Revenues Beat Estimates
summary: Electronic Arts (EA) delivered earnings and revenue surprises of +150.00% and +4.65%, respectively, for the quarter ended June 2025. Do the numbers hold clues to what lies ahead for the stock?

headline: Electronic Arts’s (NASDAQ:EA) Q2: Beats On Revenue But Full-Year Sales Guidance Misses Expectations Significantly
summary: Video game publisher Electronic Arts (NASDAQ:EA) reported Q2 CY2025 results exceeding the market’s revenue expectations, with sales up 32.4% year on year to $1.67 billion. On the other hand, next quarter’s revenue guidance of $1.8 billion was less impressive, coming in 5.9% below analysts’ estimates. Its GAAP profit of $0.79 per share was 23.8% above analysts’ consensus estimates.

headline: Electronic Arts tops Q1 forecasts, but weak Q2 guidance dampens outlook
summary: Investing.com -- Electronic Arts Inc (NASDAQ:EA) delivered a stronger-than-expected start to fiscal 2026, buoyed by robust performance in its sports portfolio, yet investor sentiment turned cautious after the company issued weaker-than-forecast guidance for the second quarter. headline: Electronic Arts: Fiscal Q1 Earnings Snapshot
summary: On a per-share basis, the Redwood City, California-based company said it had net income of 79 cents. Earnings, adjusted for one-time gains and costs, came to 25 cents per share. The results surpassed Wall Street expectations.

raw.headline: Electronic Arts: Fiscal Q1 Earnings Snapshot
raw.summary: On a per-share basis, the Redwood City, California-based company said it had net income of 79 cents. Earnings, adjusted for one-time gains and costs, came to 25 cents per share. The results surpassed Wall Street expectations.

headline: Electronic Arts Posts Better-Than-Expected First-Quarter Results
summary: Electronic Arts  logged better-than-expected profit and revenue in its fiscal first quarter, boosted in part by the strong performance of its F1 25 racing game.  The videogame developer Tuesday posted a profit of $201 million, or 79 cents a share, for the three-months ended June 30, compared with $280 million, or $1.04 a share, a year earlier.  The Redwood City, Calif., company had most recently projected first-quarter earnings of between 49 cents to 66 cents a share on revenue of $1.55 billion to $1.65 billion.

headline: Electronic Arts Reports Q1 FY26 Results
summary: REDWOOD CITY, Calif., July 29, 2025--Electronic Arts Inc. (NASDAQ: EA) today announced preliminary financial results for its first quarter ended June 30, 2025.
